action.action-desc: Mr. Panetta (for himself and Mr. Baird) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act to provide for a consistent definition for plant biostimulants.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Plant Biostimulant Act.

subsection.text: The Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (7 U.S.C. 136 et seq.) is amended by inserting after section 3 (7 U.S.C. 136a) the following:

section.text: A plant biostimulant shall not be subject to regulation under this Act.

subsection.text: Section 2 of the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (7 U.S.C. 136) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking vitamin-hormone horticultural product and inserting vitamin hormone products; and
by adding at the end the following: Such term shall not include a plant biostimulant.; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: The term plant biostimulant means a substance, microorganism, or mixture thereof, that, when applied to seeds, plants, the rhizosphere, soil, or other growth media, act to support a plant’s natural processes independently of the biostimulant’s nutrient content, thereby improving nutrient availability, uptake or use efficiency, tolerance to abiotic stress, and consequent growth, development, quality, or yield.

paragraph.text: means a compound or mixture that interacts with plant nutrients in a manner which improves nutrient availability or aids the plant in acquiring or utilizing plant nutrients; and

subsection.text: The term vitamin hormone product means a product consisting of a mixture of plant hormones, plant nutrients, inoculants, or soil amendments.

Not later than 120 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Administrator of Environmental Protection Agency shall revise the regulations under subchapter E of chapter I of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on the date of the enactment of this Act) to carry out the amendments made by subsections (a) and (b).

The Secretary of Agriculture shall conduct a study to assess the types of, and practices using, plant biostimulants (as defined in section 2 of the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (7 U.S.C. 136)) that best achieve the following:

paragraph.text: Limiting or eliminating runoff or leaching of soil or nutrients such as phosphorus and nitrogen into groundwater or other water sources.
Restoring beneficial bioactivity or healthy nutrients to the soil.
Aiding in carbon sequestration, nutrient use efficiency, and other climate-related benefits.
Supporting innovative approaches to improving agricultural sustainability, including the adoption of performance-based outcome standards and criteria.

subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the date on which funds are first made available for the study under subsection (a), the Secretary shall make publicly available and submit to the Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report that describes the results of the study.
